clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Crew Resource Management Training to Improve the Effectiveness of Surgical Safety Checklist (IDILIC)
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Crew Resource Management Training to Improve the Effectiveness of Surgical Safety Checklist

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter cluster-randomized trial will evaluate the impact of Crew Resource Management training on the occurrence of postoperative complications and the adherence to a surgical safety checklist, among a large sample of French surgical departments.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of any major postoperative complication during hospitalization
primary_outcome.time_frame: during the two phases of the study : 18 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Team's adherence to the items of surgical safety checklist
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the two phases of the study : 18 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of any postoperative death during hospitalization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the two phases of the study : 18 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Healthcare workers' attitude regarding the patient safety culture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twice during the study : the 4th and the 17th month after the beginning of the study

arm_group.arm_group_label: No CRM training of surgical teams

intervention.intervention_name: Diffusion of a surgical safety checklist

study_pop.textblock: All patients needing a surgery who are hospitalized in one of the 31 departments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years old
- Hospitalization ≥ 24 hours
- Available medical file
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal
